section.label: Create Script with Object Launch Point : Step 1 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: Specify the name of the launch point and the object that it applies to. Select the event that activates the launch point. Specify the event context, which determines when the automation script is executed. You can reuse an existing script or specify a new one. If you select a new script, the wizard guildes you through the script creation process.

section.label: Create Script with Object Launch Point : Step 2 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can import a script file that you created in another application or you can enter a script in the Source Code field in the next step.
Specify a variable to use in the script, including the variable type and the binding type. Depending on the binding type that you specify, you must enter additional values in the associated fields.

section.label: Create Script with Object Launch Point : Step 3 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can enter a script in the Source Code field, or you can import a script file in the previous step.

Specify the integration component and processing point that launch the script. Specify the scripting language that is used to write the script and then add the script or import one. Optionally, you can add variables that are applied when the script runs.

Select the type of integration component that the automation script runs on to add custom logic to the processing of integration messages. Specify a component from the list of integration components of this type, and then select the processing point where the script runs.
Create a new automation script in the language of your choice. Optionally specify variables for the script which can be used to interact with the underlying system.

section.label: Create Script with Attribute Launch Point : Step 1 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: Specify the object and the object attribute that launch the script. You can reuse an existing script or specify a new one. If you choose a new script, the wizard guides you through the script creation process.
Select the event for which you want to define the launch point.

section.label: Create Script with Attribute Launch Point : Step 2 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can import a script file that you created in another application or you can enter a script in the Source Code field in the next step.
Specify a variable to use in the script, including the variable type and the binding type. Depending on the binding type that you specify, you must enter additional values in the associated fields.

section.label: Create Script with Attribute Launch Point : Step 3 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can enter a script in the Source Code field, or you can import a script file in the previous step.

section.label: Create Script with Action Launch Point : Step 1 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: Specify the object and an action that launch the script. You can reuse an existing script or specify a new one. If you choose a new script, the wizard guides you through the script creation process.

section.label: Create Script with Action Launch Point : Step 2 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can import a script file that you created in another application or you can enter a script in the Source Code field in the next step.
Specify a variable to use in the script, including the variable type and the binding type. Depending on the binding type that you specify, you must enter additional values in the associated fields.

section.label: Create Script with Action Launch Point : Step 3 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can enter a script in the Source Code field, or you can import a script file in the previous step.

section.label: Create Script with Custom Condition Launch Point : Step 1 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: Specify a launch point name that is precisely the same as the name of the condition you intend to use. Specify the custom condition in the Conditional Expression Manager application. You can reuse an existing script or specify a new one. If you choose a new script, the wizard guides you through the script creation process.

section.label: Create Script with Custom Condition Launch Point : Step 2 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can import a script file that you created in another application or you can enter a script in the Source Code field in the next step.
Specify a variable to use in the script, including the variable type and the binding type. Depending on the binding type that you specify, you must enter additional values in the associated fields.

section.label: Create Script with Custom Condition Launch Point : Step 3 of 3

helpgrid.innerhtml: You can enter a script in the Source Code field, or you can import a script file in the previous step.
